cpsr.planning

Class EpsilonGreedyPlanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • cpsr.planning.APSRPlanner
      • cpsr.planning.EpsilonGreedyPlanner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPlanner

    public class EpsilonGreedyPlanner
extends APSRPlanner
    An epsilon greedy planner that uses a predefied policy with prob (1-epsilon). Otherwise a random policy is used. Used for sample collection in planning.
    Author:
    William Hamilton

      • EpsilonGreedyPlanner

        public EpsilonGreedyPlanner(RandomPlanner pRandPlanner,
                    APSRPlanner pPlanner,
                    double pEpsilon,
                    int pSeed)
        Constructs an epsilon greedy planner.
        Parameters:
        pRandPlanner - A random policy/planner for the domain.
        pPlanner - A planning object (non-random) for the domain.
        pEpsilon - The epsilon value to use.
        pSeed - Random seed to use.

      • learnQFunction

        public IQFunction learnQFunction(TrainingDataSet data,
                        int runs,
                        int iterations,
                        int treesPerEnsemble,
                        int k,
                        int nMin,
                        double pDiscount)
        Description copied from class: APSRPlanner
        Returns a QFunction learned using specified PSR, DataSet and tree ensemble parameters.
        Specified by:
        learnQFunction in class APSRPlanner
        runs - Number of training runs to use when collecting intial data.
        iterations - Number of iterations to use when training trees.
        treesPerEnsemble - Number of trees per ensemble.
        k - Number of splits to create at each inner node. If k is null, then sqrt(number of attribute) will be used.
        nMin - Specifies when trees stop growing if |set| < nMin at leaf, growing stops.
        pDiscount - the discount factor.
        Returns:
        Q function policy
